intro: Uvedalia clementii, commonly known as the Clementii's uvedalia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense mats on the ground. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
